conclusion: Analyzing liquid flow paths from containers A, B, and C to determine which bottom containers (D, E, or F) they will flow into.
Container A (pink) releases pink liquid, Container B (green) releases green liquid, Container C (blue) releases blue liquid.
Liquids flow downward and can interact with colored bars (baffles) placed diagonally.
Pink liquid starts flowing straight down from container A.
Pink liquid encounters the yellow baffle first and follows along it.
Pink liquid continues downward after the yellow baffle.
Pink liquid flows down to the right side of the board.
Pink liquid from A appears to flow into container F.
Green liquid flows straight down from container B.
Green liquid encounters the yellow baffle and follows along it toward the right.
Green liquid continues downward after the yellow baffle.
Green liquid merges with the blue liquid at the lower right.
Green liquid flows into container G.
Blue liquid flows straight down from container C.
Blue liquid follows a relatively straight path downward.
Blue liquid moves toward the right side of the board.
Blue liquid eventually flows into container G, merging with the green liquid.
Liquid from Container A (pink) flows into Container F.
Liquid from Container B (green) flows into Container G.
Liquid from Container C (blue) flows into Container G.
Note about potential misstatement in the question or misalignment in the image labeling.
